cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for Pyrotechnics must be at least one and at most four. You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can't be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Ridgeline Rager
cards.text: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.
cards.originalText: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rukh Egg
cards.text: When Rukh Egg dies, create a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.

rulings.text: If the Rukh Egg card is removed from the graveyard in the same turn it is put there, a Bird will still be put onto the battlefield.
If the Egg is exiled instead of being put into the graveyard, no Bird is put onto the battlefield.
Text-changing effects can be used to change the color of the Bird that will be put onto the battlefield.
If the Egg is destroyed while under the control of another player, the controller of the Egg gets the Bird.

cards.originalText: When Rukh Egg is put into a graveyard from play, put a 4/4 red Rukh creature token with flying into play at end of turn.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: To a sabretooth, all men are mice.
cards.originalText: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Searing Wind
cards.text: Searing Wind deals 10 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"The first wind of ascension is Forger, burning away impurity."
—Keld Triumphant
cards.originalText: Searing Wind deals 10 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Seismic Assault
cards.text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.
cards.originalText: Discard a land card from your hand: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I love lightning It's my best invention since the rock."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shock Troops
cards.text: Sacrifice Shock Troops: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: War is a conflict that determines not who is right—but who is left.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sizzle
cards.text: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor:
"Of course you should fight fire with fire. You should fight everything with fire."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: Most people know better. Goblins only know bigger.
cards.originalText: Sudden Impact deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.

cards.name: Thieves' Auction
cards.text: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under their control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.

rulings.text: In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.

If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

cards.originalText: Set aside all cards in play. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the cards set aside and puts it into play tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all those cards have been chosen.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Two-Headed Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature each combat.
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Two-Headed Dragon can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Two-Headed Dragon may block an additional creature.

cards.name: Viashino Sandstalker
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At end of turn, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's in play.)

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Stone
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.
cards.originalText: (Walls can't attack.)

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—Elvish champion
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.

cards.name: Call of the Wild
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: From a whisper to a roar, the call is heard by all and refused by none.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Canopy Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Choke
cards.text: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"One day we shall walk where once was water."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.originalText: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Collective Unconscious
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

cards.originalText: All Elves get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Each pluck of the strings breaks the hold of the unnatural on the world.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Elvish Pioneer
cards.text: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: "Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."
cards.originalText: When Elvish Pioneer comes into play, you may put a basic land card from your hand into play tapped.

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Elvish Scrapper
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

rulings.text: Emperor Crocodile's ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even if it's only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).
The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

cards.originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Fecundity
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may draw a card.

cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"The love of nature . . . is a furious, burning, physical greed. . . ."
—Mary Webb, The House in Dormer Forest
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Foratog
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.
cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

cards.originalText: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
cards.flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Gaea's Herald
cards.text: Creature spells can't be countered.
cards.flavor: The elves' battle cries cut paths through the Æther, guiding those who would stand in Gaea's defense.

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

cards.originalText: Creature spells can't be countered.

cards.name: Giant Badger
cards.text: Whenever Giant Badger blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Disturb a sleeping badger and the snapping of your bones will awaken the countryside.
cards.originalText: Whenever Giant Badger blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Giant Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Horned Troll
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.
cards.flavor: Sword hilts jut from some trolls' bodies where wounds healed so fast that the weapons were trapped inside.
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.

cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
cards.originalText: When Hunted Wumpus comes into play, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand into play.

cards.name: Lhurgoyf
cards.text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
cards.flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
cards.originalText: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.

cards.name: Living Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 5/6 green Treefolk creature that's still a land.
cards.flavor: Some warriors walk the earth. Others are born of it.

rulings.text: It does give the land a color and creature type, which is unlike most other ways to animate a land.
This can be placed on any land, not just Forests.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Enchanted land is a 5/6 green Treefolk creature that's still a land.

cards.name: Llanowar Behemoth
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Since the activated ability doesn't have a tap symbol in its cost, you can tap a creature (including Llanowar Behemoth itself) that hasn't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay the cost.

cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Lone Wolf deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Moss Monster
cards.flavor: After the battle, an eerie silence gripped the forest. The losers' remains were lightly dusted with green.

cards.name: Nantuko Disciple
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all lands become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"One touch of nature makes the whole world kin."
—William Shakespeare,
Troilus and Cressida
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Norwood Ranger
cards.flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

cards.name: Plow Under
cards.text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
cards.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

rulings.text: The owner decides the order the two lands are stacked there.

cards.originalText: Put two target lands on top of their owner's library.

cards.name: Primeval Force
cards.text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
cards.flavor: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.
cards.originalText: When Primeval Force comes into play, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Revive
cards.text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rhox
cards.text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
You may have Rhox deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox.

cards.name: Rushwood Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

cards.name: Spitting Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Sacrifice a land: Spitting Spider deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.originalText:
Spitting Spider may block as though it had flying.
Sacrifice a land: Spitting Spider deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Spreading Algae
cards.text:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: This card now has Enchant Swamp, which works exactly like any other Enchant ability. This means it can only be cast targeting a Swamp, and it will be put into its owner's graveyard if the permanent it's attached to ever stops being a Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Spreading Algae can enchant only a Swamp.
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy that land.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from play, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Thorn Elemental deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder
cards.originalText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Vernal Bloom
cards.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.flavor: The sun breaks, the beasts stir, and the forest awakens to stand against its enemies.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability. It does not go on the stack.

cards.originalText: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Vine Trellis
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Nature twists knots stronger than any rope.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Wing Snare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"We are the hands of the great trees, reaching out to ensnare what threatens their branches."
—Elvish hunter
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a Forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.
cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler
cards.originalText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.
cards.originalText: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures in play.

cards.name: Brass Herald
cards.text:
As Brass Herald enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
When Brass Herald enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all creature cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.

rulings.text: You must choose a creature type that already exists in Magic.

cards.originalText:
As Brass Herald comes into play, choose a creature type.
When Brass Herald comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all creature cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play that shares a creature type with it. (For example, if there are three Goblins in play, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
cards.flavor:
"A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman,
"Equality or Protection"

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

cards.originalText: During each player's turn, each other player's spells cost {3} more to play.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.
cards.originalText: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Distorting Lens
cards.text: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Eye altering alters all."
—William Blake, "The Mental Traveller"
cards.originalText: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Ensnaring Bridge
cards.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
cards.flavor:
"Why build a bridge that needs to be guarded?"
—Elvish champion

rulings.text: Ensnaring Bridge's effect checks the number of cards in your hand only while a player (including you) is declaring attackers. Once a creature has legally attacked, changing its power or the number of cards in your hand won't remove it from combat.

cards.originalText: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Woven from strands of griffin mane and pegasus tail.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Fodder Cannon
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon, Meditationes Sacrae
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.
cards.originalText: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Colossus
cards.text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
cards.originalText:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme
